panelText.text: You are always responsible for protecting the physical and digital security of all personal and confidential information in your possession. Remember to follow the golden rules for Data Privacy: Limit-Guard-Delete.

1. Limit the amount of personal data you request or provide. Only request or provide the data you need for the essential and primary purpose you want to fulfill.
  2. Guard the data from unauthorized processing, loss, damage or alteration. Control the access to and dissemination of the data.
  3. Delete the data in a proper manner once you no longer need it. Prevent and stop hoarding records.

Ensure that there is one system of record for master data files and do not work from a local copy unless you are certain you have the most recent version. Once finished, you should delete it from your local drive.
Personal and confidential data of customers, employees and business partners can be shared only with people who are authorized to see it and have a legitimate business need for the information.
